html:
** Affirm AFRM.O shares up 7.5% at $54.84 after D.A. Davidson upgrades buy now, pay later (BNPL) firm to 'buy' from 'neutral'

** After stock's "brutal" selloff, brokerage says sees much-improved risk/reward

** AFRM has fallen >60% in past 2 months as investors unwind bets on growth and fintech names amid risk-off sentiment

** D.A. Davidson raises gross merchandise value (GMV) estimate for holiday qtr to $3.7 bln, in-line with consensus, but sees potential upside from stronger consumer, recovery in travel and partnerships with Shopify SHOP.N and Amazon.com AMZN.O

** Cuts PT to $75 from $110 due to macro conditions

** Brokerage also points to concerns including credit risk, competition and regulatory scrutiny

** U.S. CFPB last month asked BNPL cos for data on products and practices putting consumers at risk (Full Story)

** Now, 8 of 14 analysts covering AFRM rate stock 'buy' or higher, rest are neutral; median PT is $105 - Refinitiv


(Lance Tupper is a Reuters market analyst. The views expressed are his own)

(( lance.tupper@thomsonreuters.com
lance.tupper@tr.com 1-332-219-1430) )
